author: The_Egg_
body:
**GREENLIGHT CAPITAL**

* Top new buys: **DNMR**, ~~FUBO, ADT, CLOV, SATS, SONO, NPA~~
* Boosted stakes in: REZI, **TECK**, CNX, DDS, AAWW

**WHALE ROCK CAPITAL MANAGEMENT**

* Top new buys: ~~DIS, UBER, ZS, SMAR, EXPE, FTCH, TRIP,~~ **BILI**, **EGHT, PDD**
* Top exits: W, BABA, MSFT, AVLR, FTNT, STNE, AMD, AYX, CDAY, NOW
* Boosted stakes in: **CRWD, CVNA, TSM, PINS, CREE, MDB, FIVN, SQ, SE, CRUS**
* Cut stakes in: AMZN, JD, FB, ZM, OKTA, SHOP, COUP, NVDA, MPWR, FSLY

author: SnooMuffins8070
body: 100% agree. AI is definitely overhyped. As someone who works in the industry, other than a handful of companies doing cutting edge AI research e.g. Google, Microsoft, etc., a lot of companies saying that they use AI are just building predictive models.

author: Daddylongsnek
body: I mean FB MSFT and AAPL already beat earnings last week, yet the Nasdaq still crashed. I think GOOG and AMZN will do pretty well too

author: Strill
body: It was undervalued because they still make decent money each year, they got a new CEO from a super-successful online store, they are planning on focusing on their online store instead of their brick & mortar stores, and because they got a new deal with Microsoft.  They're getting all the things they need to turn their business around.

author: WhimsicalCrane
body:
Yup, better than a Zoomer though.

Aiming for 10-15% on the low end of my etfs and might be switching to m1 soon to micromanage out of oil.

If you want the reckless gamble - Trying to keep my big tech (apple/microsoft/google) position super low banking on a too big to manuver or too big to innovate crash.

edit - play money is in another account holding strong. ;) Got gme, amc, and tsla buy and sell limits all set on Friday.
